ASSESS_001.name: Lachman Test
ASSESS_001.description: Most reliable test for ACL rupture. Examiner stabilizes femur and translates tibia anteriorly with knee at 20-30° flexion.

technique.procedure: Stabilize femur with one hand, grasp proximal tibia with other hand, pull tibia anteriorly
technique.positive_finding: Soft/absent endpoint, excessive anterior translation compared to unaffected side

secondary_fields.label: Patient Apprehension
secondary_fields.description: Patient guarding or fearful during test

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Compare to unaffected side...

secondary_fields.label: Additional Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Any additional observations...

endpoint_quality.clinical_significance: Absent endpoint indicates complete ACL rupture

interpretation_guide.grade_1: Mild ACL laxity - consider conservative management
interpretation_guide.grade_2: Moderate ACL injury - may require surgical consultation
interpretation_guide.grade_3: Severe ACL rupture - immediate orthopedic referral

ASSESS_002.name: McMurray Test
ASSESS_002.description: Provocative test for meniscal tears. Combines flexion/extension with rotation to trap damaged meniscus.

technique.position: Patient supine, examiner holds knee and foot
technique.procedure: Flex knee fully, apply varus/valgus stress with rotation, extend knee while maintaining stress
technique.positive_finding: Click, pop, or pain along joint line during movement

primary_fields.label: McMurray Test Result
primary_fields.description: Overall test result for meniscal pathology

options.label: Positive
options.description: Click, pop, or pain reproduced during test

options.label: Inconclusive
options.description: Unable to complete test or unclear findings

primary_fields.label: Symptoms Reproduced (if positive)
primary_fields.description: Select all symptoms that were reproduced during testing

options.label: Joint Line Pain
options.description: Pain localized to medial or lateral joint line

primary_fields.label: Primary Pain Location (if positive)
primary_fields.description: Location of pain reproduction during test

options.label: Posterior Knee
options.description: Pain in posterior aspect of knee

secondary_fields.label: Pain Intensity (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Rate the intensity of pain reproduced during test

secondary_fields.label: Range of Motion Limitation
secondary_fields.description: Check if there was limitation in knee range of motion during test

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations, patient responses, or relevant findings
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter any additional clinical observations...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary diagnostic outcome

ASSESS_003.name: Anterior Drawer Test
ASSESS_003.description: Tests ACL stability with knee at 90°. Less sensitive than Lachman for acute injuries due to hamstring guarding.

technique.position: Patient supine, hip 45° flexed, knee 90° flexed
technique.procedure: Sit on patient's foot, grasp proximal tibia, pull anteriorly
technique.positive_finding: Excessive anterior tibial translation

primary_fields.label: Anterior Drawer Test Result
primary_fields.description: Assessment of anterior tibial translation for ACL integrity

options.label: Negative
options.description: No excessive anterior translation, normal endpoint

primary_fields.label: Hamstring Guarding Present
primary_fields.description: Assess if hamstring muscle guarding affects test reliability

options.label: Mild Guarding
options.description: Some muscle tension, test somewhat reliable

primary_fields.label: Endpoint Quality
primary_fields.description: Quality of endpoint feel during anterior translation

secondary_fields.label: Pain During Test (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Pain level reported during anterior drawer maneuver

secondary_fields.label: Patient Apprehension
secondary_fields.description: Patient showed apprehension or guarding during test

secondary_fields.label: Comparison to Opposite Side
secondary_fields.description: How does this compare to the uninjured side

options.label: Significantly Increased Translation
options.description: Clear difference compared to normal side

options.label: Mildly Increased Translation
options.description: Subtle difference compared to normal side

options.label: Unable to Test Opposite Side
options.description: Bilateral injury or other limiting factors

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations, patient positioning issues, or other relevant findings
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter clinical observations about ACL integrity assessment...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary measure of ACL integrity

hamstring_guarding.clinical_significance: Critical for test reliability - guarding can mask ACL deficiency

ASSESS_004.name: Pivot Shift Test
ASSESS_004.purpose: Assess rotational instability from ACL deficiency
ASSESS_004.description: Reproduces giving way sensation in ACL-deficient knee. Most specific test for ACL rupture.

technique.procedure: Apply valgus stress and internal rotation while flexing knee from extension
technique.positive_finding: Sudden reduction/clunk at 20-30° flexion as tibia reduces

primary_fields.label: Pivot Shift Test Result
primary_fields.description: Assessment of rotational instability from ACL deficiency

options.label: Negative
options.description: No palpable clunk or shift during test

options.label: Grade 1 (Mild)
options.description: Subtle shift felt but not seen

primary_fields.label: Knee Flexion Angle at Reduction (degrees)
primary_fields.description: Angle where tibia reduction/clunk occurs (typically 20-30°)

primary_fields.label: Patient Tolerance
primary_fields.description: Patient's ability to tolerate the test procedure

options.label: Some Apprehension
options.description: Patient showed mild anxiety but test completed

options.label: Unable to Complete
options.description: Test stopped due to patient discomfort/anxiety

secondary_fields.label: Giving Way Sensation Reproduced
secondary_fields.description: Patient recognized the sensation as similar to episodes of instability

secondary_fields.label: Pain During Test (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Pain level during pivot shift maneuver

secondary_fields.label: Muscle Guarding
secondary_fields.description: Presence of protective muscle spasm

options.label: Severe Guarding
options.description: Test unreliable due to muscle tension

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about rotational instability assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about pivot shift findings, patient response, test quality...

test_result.clinical_significance: Most specific test for ACL rupture - positive result strongly indicates ACL deficiency

patient_tolerance.clinical_significance: Critical for test reliability - apprehension can prevent true positive

ASSESS_005.name: Empty Can Test (Jobe's Test)
ASSESS_005.description: Isolates supraspinatus muscle. Positive for weakness or pain suggesting tear or tendinopathy.

technique.position: Shoulder 90° abduction, 30° horizontal adduction, internal rotation (thumb down)
technique.procedure: Apply downward pressure while patient resists
technique.positive_finding: Pain or weakness compared to unaffected side

primary_fields.label: Empty Can Test Result
primary_fields.description: Overall assessment of supraspinatus function

options.label: Unable to Hold Position
options.description: Cannot maintain test position against resistance

primary_fields.label: Strength Compared to Opposite Side
primary_fields.description: Bilateral comparison of supraspinatus strength

primary_fields.label: Pain Location (if present)
primary_fields.description: Select all areas where pain occurs during test

options.label: Lateral Shoulder
options.description: Side of shoulder over greater tuberosity

secondary_fields.label: Pain Intensity During Test (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Maximum pain level during resistance testing

secondary_fields.label: Position Tolerance
secondary_fields.description: Patient's ability to achieve and maintain test position

options.label: Modified Position
options.description: Unable to achieve full position due to limitation

secondary_fields.label: Compensatory Movements Observed
secondary_fields.description: Select any compensatory patterns during testing

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about supraspinatus assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about muscle function, patient positioning, test quality...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary indicator of supraspinatus pathology

strength_comparison.clinical_significance: Bilateral comparison essential for detecting subtle deficits

ASSESS_006.name: Hawkins-Kennedy Test
ASSESS_006.description: Compresses subacromial structures. High sensitivity for impingement syndrome.

technique.procedure: Forcibly internally rotate shoulder
technique.positive_finding: Pain in subacromial region

secondary_fields.label: Patient Apprehension
secondary_fields.description: Patient hesitant or fearful during test

secondary_fields.label: Range of Motion Limitation
secondary_fields.description: Unable to achieve full internal rotation due to pain

secondary_fields.label: Painful Arc Present
secondary_fields.description: Pain occurs in specific arc of movement

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.placeholder: Compare findings to opposite shoulder...

secondary_fields.label: Additional Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Any additional observations...

pain_severity.clinical_significance: Severe pain may indicate significant impingement

interpretation_guide.positive_severe: Significant impingement - consider injection or surgery

ASSESS_007.name: Neer Impingement Test
ASSESS_007.description: Compresses structures under acromion. Often combined with Hawkins-Kennedy test.

technique.procedure: Stabilize scapula, forcibly flex shoulder through full range
technique.positive_finding: Pain with overhead motion

primary_fields.label: Neer Impingement Test Result
primary_fields.description: Assessment of subacromial impingement during forced flexion

options.label: Negative
options.description: No pain during full shoulder flexion

options.label: Inconclusive
options.description: Unable to complete test or unclear findings

primary_fields.label: Shoulder Flexion Angle When Pain Begins (degrees)
primary_fields.description: Angle at which pain first occurs during flexion movement

primary_fields.label: Pain Location During Test
primary_fields.description: Select all areas where pain occurs

secondary_fields.label: Peak Pain Intensity (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Maximum pain level during impingement test

secondary_fields.label: Range of Motion Limitation
secondary_fields.description: Limitation in shoulder flexion range

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about impingement assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about impingement signs, patient response, test quality...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary indicator of subacromial impingement

pain_onset_angle.clinical_significance: Pain typically occurs between 60-120° in impingement

ASSESS_008.name: Drop Arm Test
ASSESS_008.description: Tests ability to control arm descent. Highly specific for large rotator cuff tears.

technique.procedure: Ask patient to slowly lower arm to side
technique.positive_finding: Inability to control descent or arm drops suddenly

primary_fields.label: Drop Arm Test Result
primary_fields.description: Assessment of rotator cuff integrity during controlled arm descent

options.label: Unable to Position
options.description: Cannot achieve starting position of 90° abduction

primary_fields.label: Angle Where Drop Occurs (degrees)
primary_fields.description: Shoulder abduction angle where control is lost

primary_fields.label: Pain During Test (0-10)
primary_fields.description: Pain level during arm descent attempt

secondary_fields.label: Compensatory Mechanisms Observed
secondary_fields.description: Select any compensatory patterns during test

options.label: Opposite Arm Assistance
options.description: Using other arm to help control descent

secondary_fields.label: Visible Muscle Atrophy
secondary_fields.description: Observable atrophy in supraspinatus or infraspinatus fossa

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about rotator cuff function
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about muscle function, compensations, test quality...

test_result.clinical_significance: Highly specific for large rotator cuff tears

ASSESS_009.name: Speed's Test
ASSESS_009.description: Stresses long head of biceps. Positive for bicipital tendinitis or SLAP lesions.

technique.position: Shoulder flexed 90°, elbow extended, forearm supinated
technique.procedure: Apply downward pressure while patient resists
technique.positive_finding: Pain in bicipital groove

primary_fields.label: Speed's Test Result
primary_fields.description: Assessment of biceps tendon pathology during resistance testing

options.label: Negative
options.description: No pain in bicipital groove during resistance

options.label: Positive
options.description: Pain reproduced in bicipital groove area

options.label: Inconclusive
options.description: Unable to complete test or unclear findings

primary_fields.label: Pain Location During Test
primary_fields.description: Select all areas where pain occurs during resistance

options.label: Bicipital Groove
options.description: Anterior humeral head where biceps tendon lies

options.label: Deep Shoulder (Superior Labrum)
options.description: Deep internal shoulder pain suggesting SLAP lesion

options.label: Radiating Down Arm
options.description: Pain extends distally along biceps muscle

primary_fields.label: Patient's Resistance Strength
primary_fields.description: Patient's ability to resist examiner's downward pressure

options.label: Unable to Resist
options.description: Cannot maintain position against examiner force

secondary_fields.label: Pain Intensity During Test (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Maximum pain level during resistance testing

secondary_fields.label: Position Tolerance
secondary_fields.description: Patient's ability to achieve and maintain test position

options.label: Full Position Achieved
options.description: 90° shoulder flexion, full elbow extension maintained

options.label: Modified Position Required
options.description: Unable to achieve full test position

secondary_fields.label: Biceps Tendon Palpation Findings
secondary_fields.description: Palpation of biceps tendon in groove during test

options.label: Normal
options.description: Tendon felt normally in groove, no tenderness

options.label: Subluxation
options.description: Tendon movement out of groove felt

options.label: Not Palpable
options.description: Unable to locate or feel tendon

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about biceps tendon assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about tendon function, patient positioning, test quality...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary indicator of biceps tendon pathology or SLAP lesion

pain_location.clinical_significance: Pain location helps differentiate bicipital tendinitis from SLAP lesions

ASSESS_010.name: Straight Leg Raise (SLR/Lasègue)
ASSESS_010.description: Tensions sciatic nerve. Gold standard for lumbar radiculopathy, especially L4-S1.

technique.procedure: Passively flex hip with knee extended until symptoms reproduced
technique.positive_finding: Radiating pain below knee at <70° hip flexion

modifications.crossed_SLR: Lift unaffected leg, positive if symptoms on affected side (high specificity)
modifications.bowstring_sign: Flex knee slightly then press popliteal fossa

secondary_fields.label: Additional Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Any additional observations...

pain_location.clinical_significance: Below-knee pain indicates nerve root compression

ASSESS_011.name: Slump Test
ASSESS_011.description: Combines spinal flexion with SLR to maximize neural tension. More sensitive than SLR alone.

technique.position: Patient seated at edge of table
technique.procedure: Sequential: thoracic slump → cervical flexion → knee extension → ankle dorsiflexion
technique.positive_finding: Reproduction of symptoms, relieved by cervical extension

primary_fields.label: Slump Test Result
primary_fields.description: Overall test result for neural mechanosensitivity

options.label: Negative
options.description: No symptom reproduction through full sequence

options.label: Positive
options.description: Symptoms reproduced and relieved with cervical extension

options.label: Inconclusive
options.description: Symptoms reproduced but not relieved with cervical extension

primary_fields.label: Symptoms Reproduced During Test
primary_fields.description: Select all symptoms that occurred during slump sequence

options.label: Back Pain
options.description: Pain in lumbar or thoracic spine

primary_fields.label: Stage Where Symptoms First Appeared
primary_fields.description: Which component of the test sequence first reproduced symptoms

secondary_fields.label: Relief with Cervical Extension
secondary_fields.description: Did cervical extension reduce or eliminate symptoms

secondary_fields.label: Peak Symptom Intensity (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Maximum symptom intensity during test sequence

secondary_fields.label: Range of Motion Limitations
secondary_fields.description: Select any movement restrictions observed

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about neural tension assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about test sequence, patient response, symptom behavior...

test_result.clinical_significance: High sensitivity and specificity for neural mechanosensitivity

cervical_extension_relief.clinical_significance: Cervical extension relief confirms neural tissue involvement

ASSESS_012.name: Spurling's Test
ASSESS_012.description: Narrows intervertebral foramen to compress nerve root. Highly specific when positive.

technique.procedure: Extend, laterally flex, and rotate neck to affected side, apply axial compression
technique.positive_finding: Radiating pain into arm on tested side

ASSESS_013.name: FABER Test (Patrick's Test)
ASSESS_013.purpose: Differentiate hip vs SI joint pathology
ASSESS_013.description: Figure-4 position stresses hip and SI joint. Pain location indicates source.

technique.position: Supine, tested leg in figure-4 (flexion, abduction, external rotation)
technique.procedure: Stabilize opposite ASIS, apply gentle downward pressure on flexed knee
technique.positive_finding: Groin pain suggests hip pathology, posterior pain suggests SI joint

options.label: Positive - SI Joint Pain
options.description: Posterior pain suggesting SI joint pathology

options.label: Positive - Both Areas
options.description: Both hip and SI joint pain

ASSESS_014.name: FADIR Test
ASSESS_014.description: Provokes impingement between femoral neck and acetabular rim.

technique.procedure: Flex hip to 90°, then adduct and internally rotate
technique.positive_finding: Groin pain or clicking

ASSESS_015.name: Thomas Test
ASSESS_015.description: Identifies iliopsoas and rectus femoris tightness. Modified version more specific.

technique.position: Patient supine at edge of table
technique.procedure: Flex one hip to chest, observe position of opposite hip
technique.positive_finding: Tested hip rises off table (hip flexor tightness) or knee extends (rectus femoris)

ASSESS_016.name: Ober's Test
ASSESS_016.description: Tests iliotibial band and tensor fascia lata tightness.

technique.procedure: Abduct and extend top hip, then slowly lower
technique.positive_finding: Leg remains abducted or patient feels lateral knee/thigh tightness

options.label: Negative
options.description: Leg lowers to neutral or below horizontal

secondary_fields.label: Hip Abduction Angle (degrees)
secondary_fields.description: Angle at which leg stops above horizontal

secondary_fields.label: Symptom Location
secondary_fields.description: Select areas where tightness or discomfort is felt

secondary_fields.label: Discomfort/Tightness Intensity (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Rate the intensity of tightness or discomfort

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.description: Compare findings between sides

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about IT band flexibility assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about muscle tension, patient positioning, test modifications...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary indicator of IT band/TFL tightness

ASSESS_017.name: Tinel's Sign (Carpal Tunnel)
ASSESS_017.description: Percusses over median nerve at wrist. Positive in carpal tunnel syndrome.

technique.procedure: Tap over carpal tunnel (volar wrist)
technique.positive_finding: Tingling/paresthesias in median nerve distribution

options.label: Positive - Mild
options.description: Mild tingling in median nerve distribution

secondary_fields.label: Symptom Distribution
secondary_fields.description: Select fingers/areas where symptoms are felt

secondary_fields.label: Symptom Quality
secondary_fields.description: Select all symptom types experienced

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.description: Compare findings between hands

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about median nerve assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about nerve irritability, patient response, symptom latency...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary indicator of median nerve irritation at carpal tunnel

ASSESS_018.name: Phalen's Test
ASSESS_018.description: Sustained wrist flexion compresses median nerve. More sensitive than Tinel's.

technique.procedure: Allow wrists to fall into maximum flexion for 60 seconds
technique.positive_finding: Paresthesias in median nerve distribution

primary_fields.label: Symptom Onset Time (seconds)
primary_fields.description: Time when symptoms first appear

secondary_fields.label: Symptom Distribution
secondary_fields.description: Select areas where symptoms are felt

secondary_fields.label: Symptom Intensity (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Rate the intensity of paresthesias

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about carpal tunnel assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about symptom progression, patient tolerance...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary indicator of carpal tunnel syndrome

ASSESS_019.name: Finkelstein's Test
ASSESS_019.description: Stresses tendons of first dorsal compartment. Highly sensitive for De Quervain's.

technique.procedure: Ulnar deviate wrist while maintaining thumb position
technique.positive_finding: Sharp pain over radial styloid

secondary_fields.label: Pain Intensity (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Rate the pain during ulnar deviation

secondary_fields.label: Pain Location
secondary_fields.description: Select areas where pain is felt

secondary_fields.label: Thumb Position Quality
secondary_fields.description: Assessment of thumb positioning during test

options.label: Proper Flexion
options.description: Thumb fully flexed into palm, enclosed by fingers

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about De Quervain's assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about tendon quality, swelling, functional impact...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary indicator of De Quervain's tenosynovitis

ASSESS_020.name: Thompson Test
ASSESS_020.description: Tests continuity of Achilles tendon. Absence of plantar flexion indicates complete rupture.

technique.position: Patient prone, feet hanging off table
technique.procedure: Squeeze calf muscle
technique.positive_finding: Absence of plantar flexion

options.label: Positive
options.description: Absent or significantly diminished plantar flexion

secondary_fields.label: Plantar Flexion Response
secondary_fields.description: Quality of ankle movement with calf squeeze

secondary_fields.label: Calf Squeeze Force Applied
secondary_fields.description: Amount of force used during calf compression

options.label: Gentle
options.description: Light squeeze, adequate for normal response

options.label: Firm
options.description: Firm squeeze required to elicit response

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.description: Compare response between ankles

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about Achilles tendon assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about tendon continuity, palpable defect, functional implications...

test_result.clinical_significance: Critical test for Achilles tendon rupture - positive test requires immediate orthopedic referral

ASSESS_021.name: Anterior Drawer Test (Ankle)
ASSESS_021.description: Tests ATFL integrity, most commonly injured ankle ligament.

technique.procedure: Stabilize tibia, pull talus anteriorly
technique.positive_finding: Excessive anterior translation, soft endpoint

options.label: Grade 3 Positive
options.description: Marked anterior translation, very soft endpoint

secondary_fields.label: Anterior Translation Distance (mm)
secondary_fields.description: Estimated distance of anterior talus movement

secondary_fields.label: Endpoint Quality
secondary_fields.description: Quality of resistance at end range

secondary_fields.label: Patient Apprehension
secondary_fields.description: Patient response during test

options.label: Severe Apprehension
options.description: Patient stops test due to fear

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.description: Compare stability between ankles

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about ATFL assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about ligament integrity, swelling, functional implications...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary indicator of ATFL injury - most common ankle ligament injury

ASSESS_022.name: Babinski Sign
ASSESS_022.description: Pathological reflex indicating corticospinal tract damage. Normal in infants <1 year.

technique.procedure: Stroke lateral sole from heel to ball of foot with blunt object
technique.positive_finding: Extension of great toe with fanning of other toes

interpretation.significance: Upper motor neuron lesion above L5 level

options.label: Positive (Pathological)
options.description: Extension of great toe with/without fanning

secondary_fields.label: Toe Response Pattern
secondary_fields.description: Select all observed responses

secondary_fields.label: Stimulus Intensity Used
secondary_fields.description: Force of plantar stimulation

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.description: Compare responses between feet

options.label: Left Positive Only
options.description: Only left foot shows pathological response

options.label: Right Positive Only
options.description: Only right foot shows pathological response

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional neurological observations
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about response quality, patient cooperation, associated findings...

test_result.clinical_significance: Critical neurological sign - positive test indicates upper motor neuron lesion requiring neurological evaluation

ASSESS_023.name: Hoffman's Sign
ASSESS_023.purpose: Detect cervical myelopathy/upper motor neuron lesion
ASSESS_023.description: Upper extremity equivalent of Babinski. Indicates cervical cord compression.

technique.procedure: Flick distal phalanx of middle finger into flexion
technique.positive_finding: Thumb and index finger flex/adduct

clinical_significance.with_other_signs: Suggests myelopathy when combined with hyperreflexia

options.label: Negative
options.description: No thumb or index finger movement

secondary_fields.label: Response Pattern
secondary_fields.description: Select all movements observed

options.label: Index Finger Flexion
options.description: Index finger flexes at IP joints

secondary_fields.label: Stimulus Quality
secondary_fields.description: Force of middle finger flick

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.description: Compare responses between hands

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional neurological observations
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about reflex quality, associated hyperreflexia, functional implications...

test_result.clinical_significance: Important sign of cervical myelopathy - unilateral positive more concerning than bilateral

ASSESS_024.name: Dermatome Testing
ASSESS_024.purpose: Map sensory deficits to nerve root levels
ASSESS_024.description: Tests light touch and pinprick sensation in specific skin areas innervated by single nerve roots.

technique.procedure: Test bilaterally with cotton/pin, compare sides

primary_fields.label: Testing Methods Used
primary_fields.description: Select all modalities tested

secondary_fields.label: Specific Dermatomes Tested
secondary_fields.description: Select all nerve root levels tested

secondary_fields.label: Overall Sensation Findings
secondary_fields.description: General assessment of sensory function

secondary_fields.label: Deficit Severity
secondary_fields.description: Grade the sensory loss if present

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Detailed sensory mapping findings
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter specific dermatome findings, patterns, reliability of testing...

body_region_tested.clinical_significance: Essential for mapping neurological deficits to specific nerve root levels

ASSESS_025.name: Myotome Testing
ASSESS_025.purpose: Identify motor weakness by nerve root level
ASSESS_025.description: Manual muscle testing of movements innervated by specific nerve roots.

secondary_fields.label: Specific Myotomes Tested
secondary_fields.description: Select all nerve root levels tested

secondary_fields.label: Weakness Severity (MRC Scale)
secondary_fields.description: Grade the most significant weakness found

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.description: Compare strength between sides

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Detailed motor testing findings
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter specific strength grades, patterns of weakness, functional implications...

body_region_tested.clinical_significance: Essential for identifying motor deficits at specific nerve root levels

ASSESS_026.name: Deep Tendon Reflexes
ASSESS_026.description: Tests monosynaptic reflex arcs. Hyperreflexia suggests upper motor neuron lesion, hyporeflexia suggests lower motor neuron or peripheral nerve lesion.

secondary_fields.label: Significant Bilateral Asymmetry
secondary_fields.description: Notable difference between left and right sides

secondary_fields.label: Clonus Details
secondary_fields.placeholder: If clonus present, describe duration and characteristics...

secondary_fields.label: Additional Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Any additional observations...

all_reflexes_required.message: All bilateral reflexes must be tested

biceps_left.technique: Strike biceps tendon with reflex hammer

triceps_left.technique: Strike triceps tendon just above olecranon

achilles_left.technique: Strike Achilles tendon with foot dorsiflexed

computed_fields.lower_motor_neuron_pattern: any(['0', '1+'] in [biceps_left, biceps_right, triceps_left, triceps_right, patellar_left, patellar_right, achilles_left, achilles_right])
computed_fields.clonus_present: any(['4+'] in [biceps_left, biceps_right, triceps_left, triceps_right, patellar_left, patellar_right, achilles_left, achilles_right])

lower_motor_neuron.clinical_significance: Suggests peripheral nerve or nerve root pathology

interpretation_guide.hyperreflexia: Reflexes 3+ or 4+ suggest upper motor neuron lesion
interpretation_guide.hyporeflexia: Reflexes 0 or 1+ suggest lower motor neuron lesion
interpretation_guide.asymmetry: Significant side-to-side difference suggests unilateral pathology

ASSESS_027.name: Romberg Test
ASSESS_027.description: Tests proprioceptive function. Positive suggests posterior column or vestibular dysfunction.

technique.procedure: Eyes open for 30 seconds, then eyes closed
technique.positive_finding: Significant sway or loss of balance with eyes closed

options.label: Negative
options.description: Minimal sway with eyes closed, maintains balance

options.label: Positive - Mild
options.description: Increased sway with eyes closed but maintains stance

options.label: Positive - Moderate
options.description: Significant sway, requires step to maintain balance

options.label: Positive - Severe
options.description: Loss of balance, cannot maintain stance with eyes closed

secondary_fields.label: Eyes Open Performance
secondary_fields.description: Balance with visual input

options.label: Unstable
options.description: Difficulty maintaining position even with eyes open

secondary_fields.label: Time Maintained Eyes Closed (seconds)
secondary_fields.description: Maximum time patient maintained stance with eyes closed

secondary_fields.label: Primary Sway Direction
secondary_fields.description: Select primary directions of imbalance

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional balance and proprioception observations
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about balance strategies, compensation patterns, safety concerns...

test_result.clinical_significance: Essential test for proprioceptive and vestibular function - positive test warrants further neurological evaluation

ASSESS_028.name: Dix-Hallpike Test
ASSESS_028.description: Provokes vertigo and nystagmus in benign paroxysmal positional vertigo.

technique.procedure: Turn head 45°, quickly lie back with head extended 30° below horizontal
technique.positive_finding: Rotatory nystagmus and vertigo after latency period

secondary_fields.label: Nystagmus Present
secondary_fields.description: Observed eye movements

secondary_fields.label: Vertigo Intensity (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Patient-reported severity of dizziness/spinning

secondary_fields.label: Latency Period (seconds)
secondary_fields.description: Time delay before symptoms appear

secondary_fields.label: Symptom Duration (seconds)
secondary_fields.description: How long symptoms lasted

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.description: Compare responses between sides

options.label: Right Positive Only
options.description: Only positive when head turned right

options.label: Left Positive Only
options.description: Only positive when head turned left

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional vestibular assessment observations
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about nystagmus quality, patient tolerance, associated symptoms...

test_result.clinical_significance: Gold standard test for posterior canal BPPV - positive test indicates specific vestibular disorder requiring canalith repositioning

ASSESS_029.name: Apprehension Test (Shoulder)
ASSESS_029.description: Reproduces feeling of instability in patients with recurrent dislocations.

technique.position: Supine, shoulder at edge of table
technique.procedure: Abduct 90°, externally rotate slowly
technique.positive_finding: Apprehension or guarding before end range

relocation_test.procedure: Apply posterior force to humeral head
relocation_test.interpretation: Relief of apprehension confirms anterior instability

options.label: Negative
options.description: No apprehension, full external rotation achieved

options.label: Positive - Moderate
options.description: Clear apprehension, patient guards against movement

secondary_fields.label: External Rotation Angle at Apprehension (degrees)
secondary_fields.description: Angle where apprehension first occurs

secondary_fields.label: Relocation Test Performed
secondary_fields.description: Was posterior pressure applied to confirm instability

options.label: Positive
options.description: Relief of apprehension with posterior pressure

secondary_fields.label: Patient Description of Sensation
secondary_fields.description: How patient describes the feeling during test

secondary_fields.label: Muscle Guarding
secondary_fields.description: Protective muscle contraction observed

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.description: Compare stability between shoulders

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about shoulder stability
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about instability patterns, patient history, functional implications...

test_result.clinical_significance: Key test for anterior shoulder instability - positive test with positive relocation confirms diagnosis

ASSESS_030.name: Sacroiliac Joint Compression Test
ASSESS_030.description: Compresses SI joints to provoke pain. Part of SI joint test cluster.

technique.procedure: Apply downward pressure on lateral pelvis
technique.positive_finding: Pain in SI joint region

ASSESS_030.cluster_interpretation: 3+ positive tests in cluster increase diagnostic accuracy

options.label: Positive - Mild
options.description: Mild pain in SI joint region

options.label: Positive - Moderate
options.description: Moderate SI joint pain, clear positive test

options.label: Positive - Severe
options.description: Severe SI joint pain, patient stops test

secondary_fields.label: Pain Intensity (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Rate the SI joint pain during compression

secondary_fields.label: Pain Location
secondary_fields.description: Select areas where pain is felt

secondary_fields.label: Compression Force Applied
secondary_fields.description: Amount of force needed to provoke symptoms

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.description: Compare responses between sides

secondary_fields.label: SI Joint Test Cluster Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional notes about SI joint assessment cluster
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter notes about other SI tests performed, overall pattern, functional implications...

test_result.clinical_significance: Part of SI joint test cluster - requires multiple positive tests for diagnosis

ASSESS_031.name: Gaenslen's Test
ASSESS_031.description: Simultaneously flexes one hip and extends the other to stress SI joint.

technique.procedure: Flex one hip to chest, let other leg hang off table
technique.positive_finding: Pain in SI joint on extended side

options.label: Positive - Mild
options.description: Mild SI joint or hip pain reproduced

secondary_fields.label: Pain Intensity (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Rate the pain during hip extension

secondary_fields.label: Pain Location
secondary_fields.description: Select areas where pain is felt

options.label: Posterior Thigh
options.description: Back of thigh on extended side

secondary_fields.label: Hip Extension Range Achieved
secondary_fields.description: Amount of hip extension during test

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.description: Compare responses between sides

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about SI joint assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about SI joint mechanics, patient tolerance, combined with other SI tests...

test_result.clinical_significance: Part of SI joint test cluster - positive test suggests SI joint dysfunction

ASSESS_032.name: Trendelenburg Test
ASSESS_032.description: Identifies gluteus medius weakness. Positive in hip pathology or L5 radiculopathy.

technique.procedure: Stand on one leg for 30 seconds
technique.positive_finding: Pelvis drops on unsupported side

causes.neurological: L5 nerve root, superior gluteal nerve

options.label: Negative
options.description: Pelvis remains level during single leg stance

options.label: Positive - Mild
options.description: Slight pelvic drop on unsupported side

options.label: Positive - Severe
options.description: Marked pelvic drop, cannot maintain stance

options.label: Left Leg Stance
options.description: Standing on left leg, right leg lifted

options.label: Right Leg Stance
options.description: Standing on right leg, left leg lifted

secondary_fields.label: Time Maintained (seconds)
secondary_fields.description: Maximum time patient maintained single leg stance

secondary_fields.label: Compensation Patterns
secondary_fields.description: Select any compensatory movements observed

secondary_fields.label: Pelvic Drop Severity
secondary_fields.description: Degree of pelvic drop on unsupported side

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.description: Compare hip abductor strength between sides

options.label: Left Hip Abductors Weaker
options.description: Left stance leg shows more weakness

options.label: Right Hip Abductors Weaker
options.description: Right stance leg shows more weakness

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about hip abductor assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about balance strategies, functional implications, patient effort...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary indicator of hip abductor weakness - positive test suggests gluteus medius dysfunction

ASSESS_033.name: Adson's Test
ASSESS_033.description: Assesses vascular compromise in thoracic outlet. Multiple variations exist.

technique.procedure: Extend and rotate head toward tested side, deep breath, hold
technique.positive_finding: Diminished radial pulse or reproduction of symptoms

options.label: Negative
options.description: No pulse changes or symptom reproduction

secondary_fields.label: Symptoms Reproduced
secondary_fields.description: Select all symptoms reproduced during test

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about thoracic outlet assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about vascular changes, neurological symptoms...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary test for thoracic outlet syndrome

ASSESS_034.name: Lift-Off Test
ASSESS_034.description: Isolates subscapularis function. Positive indicates tear or weakness.

technique.position: Hand behind back at lumbar level
technique.procedure: Lift hand away from back against resistance
technique.positive_finding: Inability to lift hand or maintain position

alternative.belly_press: For patients with limited internal rotation

options.label: Negative
options.description: Can lift hand away from back and maintain position

options.label: Positive - Inability to Lift
options.description: Cannot lift hand away from back

options.label: Positive - Weakness
options.description: Can lift but cannot maintain against resistance

options.label: Unable to Test
options.description: Cannot achieve test position due to limitations

secondary_fields.label: Alternative Tests Used
secondary_fields.description: Select if alternative subscapularis tests were performed

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about subscapularis assessment
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about muscle function, compensatory patterns...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary test for subscapularis integrity - positive suggests rotator cuff tear

ASSESS_035.name: Noble Compression Test
ASSESS_035.description: Compresses IT band over lateral femoral epicondyle during knee motion.

technique.procedure: Apply pressure over lateral epicondyle while flexing/extending knee
technique.positive_finding: Pain at 30° flexion as IT band passes over epicondyle

primary_fields.label: Noble Compression Test Result
primary_fields.description: Overall test result for IT band syndrome

options.label: Positive
options.description: Pain reproduced over lateral epicondyle during knee motion

options.label: Negative
options.description: No pain reproduced during compression test

options.label: Inconclusive
options.description: Test limited by patient factors or unclear findings

primary_fields.label: Primary Pain Location (if positive)
primary_fields.description: Location where pain is most prominent during test

options.label: Lateral Femoral Epicondyle
options.description: Pain directly over the lateral epicondyle

options.label: Lateral Knee General
options.description: Diffuse pain along lateral aspect of knee

options.label: Distal IT Band
options.description: Pain along IT band insertion site

primary_fields.label: Knee Flexion Angle Most Painful (degrees)
primary_fields.description: Knee flexion angle where maximum pain occurs

secondary_fields.label: Pain Intensity During Test (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Maximum pain level reproduced during compression

secondary_fields.label: Pain Quality
secondary_fields.description: Characteristics of pain reproduced during test

secondary_fields.label: Compression Pressure Applied
secondary_fields.description: Amount of pressure needed to reproduce symptoms

options.label: Light Pressure
options.description: Minimal pressure needed to reproduce pain

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations, patient responses, or relevant findings
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter any additional clinical observations about IT band assessment...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary diagnostic outcome for IT band syndrome

knee_angle_most_painful.clinical_significance: Diagnostic specificity - pain at 30° is classic for ITBS

ASSESS_036.name: Patellar Apprehension Test
ASSESS_036.description: Assesses for history of patellar dislocation/subluxation.

technique.procedure: Apply lateral force to patella
technique.positive_finding: Apprehension or quadriceps contraction

secondary_fields.label: Type of Apprehension Response
secondary_fields.description: Select observed responses during test

options.label: Familiar Feeling
options.description: Patient recognizes sensation from previous episodes

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about patellar stability
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about instability patterns, patient history...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary indicator of patellar instability - positive suggests history of dislocation

ASSESS_037.name: Varus/Valgus Stress Test
ASSESS_037.description: Tests MCL (valgus) and LCL (varus) stability at knee, or collaterals at elbow.

technique.procedure: Apply varus or valgus force
technique.positive_finding: Excessive gapping or lack of endpoint

options.label: Grade 3 Injury
options.description: Significant laxity, soft or no endpoint

options.label: Both Directions
options.description: Tested in both varus and valgus

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about ligament stability
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about endpoint quality, pain response, functional implications...

test_result.clinical_significance: Grades collateral ligament injury severity

ASSESS_038.name: Ottawa Ankle Rules
ASSESS_038.purpose: Determine need for X-ray after ankle injury
ASSESS_038.description: Validated rules to identify fractures. High sensitivity reduces unnecessary imaging.

criteria.ankle_xray: Pain at posterior edge/tip of either malleolus OR inability to bear weight
criteria.foot_xray: Pain at navicular/5th metatarsal base OR inability to bear weight

options.label: No X-ray Needed
options.description: Ottawa criteria not met, low fracture probability

options.label: Both X-rays Indicated
options.description: Meets criteria for both ankle and foot imaging

options.label: Able to Bear Weight
options.description: Can take 4 steps immediately after injury and in ED

options.label: Unable to Bear Weight
options.description: Cannot take 4 steps immediately after injury or in ED

secondary_fields.label: Ankle Pain Locations
secondary_fields.description: Select areas with bone tenderness

secondary_fields.label: Foot Pain Locations
secondary_fields.description: Select areas with bone tenderness

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional clinical decision-making factors
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter additional factors influencing imaging decision...

overall_recommendation.clinical_significance: Evidence-based clinical decision rule for fracture screening

ASSESS_039.name: Canadian C-Spine Rules
ASSESS_039.purpose: Determine need for cervical imaging after trauma
ASSESS_039.description: Evidence-based tool to safely rule out cervical spine injury.
ASSESS_039.range_of_motion: If low risk present and no high risk, test 45° rotation each way

options.label: No Imaging Needed
options.description: Low risk factors present, ROM assessment passed

options.label: Imaging Indicated
options.description: High risk factors present or ROM restricted

primary_fields.label: High Risk Factors Present
primary_fields.description: Select any high risk factors identified

secondary_fields.label: Range of Motion Assessment
secondary_fields.description: 45° rotation each way (only if no high risk factors)

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional clinical decision factors
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter additional factors influencing imaging decision...

imaging_recommendation.clinical_significance: Evidence-based cervical spine imaging decision rule

ASSESS_040.name: Cranial Nerve Screen
ASSESS_040.description: Systematic evaluation of 12 cranial nerves for neurological dysfunction.

primary_fields.label: CN III, IV, VI - Eye Movement Assessment

options.label: Normal
options.description: Equal sensation all three divisions bilaterally

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Record any additional findings, asymmetries, or clinical correlations...

ASSESS_041.name: Watson's Test (Scaphoid Shift)
ASSESS_041.description: Assesses scapholunate ligament integrity. Positive in SLAC wrist development.

technique.procedure: Apply pressure to scaphoid tubercle while moving wrist from ulnar to radial deviation
technique.positive_finding: Painful clunk or excessive translation of scaphoid

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about scapholunate stability
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about ligament integrity, functional implications...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary indicator of scapholunate instability

ASSESS_042.name: Froment's Sign
ASSESS_042.description: Tests adductor pollicis strength. Positive indicates ulnar nerve dysfunction.

technique.position: Patient holds paper between thumb and index finger
technique.procedure: Examiner attempts to pull paper away
technique.positive_finding: Thumb IP joint flexes (substitution with FPL due to adductor pollicis weakness)

options.label: Negative
options.description: No thumb IP flexion, strong pinch grip

options.label: Positive - Severe
options.description: Unable to hold paper, marked substitution

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about ulnar nerve function
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about nerve function, grip strength patterns...

test_result.clinical_significance: Primary indicator of ulnar nerve dysfunction

ASSESS_043.name: Allen's Test
ASSESS_043.description: Evaluates collateral circulation before arterial puncture or surgery. Essential safety test.

technique.procedure: Occlude both radial and ulnar arteries, release one at a time
technique.positive_finding: Normal: hand reperfuses in <6 seconds. Abnormal: >10 seconds indicates poor collateral flow

ASSESS_043.clinical_significance: Abnormal test contraindicates radial artery procedures

secondary_fields.label: Reperfusion Time (seconds)
secondary_fields.description: Time for hand to return to normal color

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional vascular assessment observations
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about arterial circulation, clinical implications...

test_result.clinical_significance: Critical safety test before arterial procedures

ASSESS_044.name: Prone Instability Test
ASSESS_044.description: Detects segmental instability. Part of clinical prediction rule for stabilization exercises.

technique.position: Prone with legs off table, toes on floor
technique.procedure: Apply PA pressure to spinous processes, then repeat with patient lifting legs
technique.positive_finding: Pain with pressure that resolves when legs lifted (muscles stabilize)

options.label: Negative
options.description: No pain or pain persists with leg lifting

options.label: Positive
options.description: Pain with pressure that resolves when legs lifted

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.description: Additional observations about spinal stability
secondary_fields.placeholder: Enter observations about instability patterns...

test_result.clinical_significance: Key component of lumbar stabilization clinical prediction rule

ASSESS_045.name: Stork Test (Spondylolysis)
ASSESS_045.description: Single leg hyperextension test. Sensitive for spondylolysis in young athletes.

options.label: Negative
options.description: No pain reproduction during single leg hyperextension

options.label: Positive - Mild Pain
options.description: Mild lower back pain reproduced on stance side

options.label: Positive - Severe Pain
options.description: Severe pain prevents completion of test

options.label: Unable to Perform
options.description: Patient cannot balance on single leg

options.label: Left Side
options.description: Pain on left during left leg stance

options.label: Right Side
options.description: Pain on right during right leg stance

options.label: Cannot Balance
options.description: Unable to maintain single leg stance

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Note any additional observations, patient history of spondylolysis, or imaging recommendations...

technique.procedure: Hyperextend and rotate spine toward stance leg
technique.positive_finding: Reproduction of pain on ipsilateral side

options.label: Lumbar Spine
options.description: Testing lumbar facet joints and foramina

options.label: Cervical Spine
options.description: Testing cervical facet joints and foramina

options.label: Negative
options.description: No pain reproduction with combined movement

options.label: Positive - Local Pain
options.description: Local spine pain suggests facet joint irritation

options.label: Positive - Radiating Pain
options.description: Radiating pain suggests nerve root compression

options.label: Left Side
options.description: Pain reproduced during left side testing

options.label: Right Side
options.description: Pain reproduced during right side testing

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Record patient positioning, specific pain patterns, or differential diagnosis considerations...

technique.procedure: Guide into extension, lateral flexion, and rotation to same side
technique.positive_finding: Local back pain suggests facet joint, radiating pain suggests nerve root compression

variations.lumbar: Can perform in standing or seated

ASSESS_047.name: Barlow Test
ASSESS_047.description: Provocative test for developmental dysplasia of hip (DDH). Performed with Ortolani test.

primary_fields.label: Patient Age (weeks)
primary_fields.description: Age in weeks (test most reliable 0-3 months)

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Record examination conditions, parent concerns, follow-up recommendations...

technique.procedure: Adduct hip while applying posterior force
technique.positive_finding: Palpable clunk as femoral head dislocates posteriorly

ASSESS_048.name: Ortolani Test
ASSESS_048.description: Relocation test for DDH. Companion to Barlow test.

primary_fields.label: Patient Age (weeks)
primary_fields.description: Age in weeks (reliable up to 6 months)

options.label: Negative
options.description: No reduction clunk, hip appears stable

options.label: Positive - Reduction
options.description: Palpable clunk with hip reduction into socket

options.label: Negative
options.description: No reduction clunk, hip appears stable

options.label: Positive - Reduction
options.description: Palpable clunk with hip reduction into socket

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Document reduction quality, parental history, need for imaging or referral...

technique.procedure: Abduct hip while lifting greater trochanter anteriorly
technique.positive_finding: Palpable clunk as femoral head reduces into acetabulum

ASSESS_048.clinical_note: Positive after 3 months suggests fixed dislocation

ASSESS_049.name: Galeazzi Sign (Allis Test)
ASSESS_049.purpose: Detect leg length discrepancy or DDH
ASSESS_049.description: Compares knee heights to identify femoral shortening or hip dislocation.

options.label: Unable to Assess
options.description: Infant position or cooperation prevents assessment

primary_fields.label: Patient Age (weeks)
primary_fields.description: Age in weeks (test reliable from birth to 2 years)

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Document specific measurements, parental concerns, or additional observations...

technique.position: Infant supine, hips and knees flexed, feet flat
technique.procedure: Observe knee heights from foot of table
technique.positive_finding: Unequal knee heights (affected side lower)

ASSESS_050.name: Rib Spring Test
ASSESS_050.description: Evaluates costovertebral and costotransverse joint mobility. Important for breathing dysfunction.

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Record specific rib levels affected, breathing observations, postural correlations...

technique.procedure: Apply anterolateral pressure to rib angles
technique.positive_finding: Restricted movement or pain reproduction

ASSESS_050.clinical_relevance: Affects breathing patterns and thoracic spine mobility

ASSESS_051.name: Breathing Pattern Assessment
ASSESS_051.description: Identifies dysfunctional breathing patterns affecting musculoskeletal system.

options.label: Diaphragmatic
options.description: Normal pattern - abdomen rises on inspiration

primary_fields.label: Respiratory Rate (breaths/min)
primary_fields.description: Count breaths per minute at rest

options.label: Equal Phases (1:1)
options.description: Inspiration and expiration of equal length

options.label: Sternocleidomastoid
options.description: Visible SCM muscle activation during quiet breathing

options.label: Upper Trapezius
options.description: Upper trap muscle engagement during breathing

secondary_fields.label: Breath Holding During Movement
secondary_fields.description: Patient holds breath during physical activity or stress

secondary_fields.label: Postural Observations
secondary_fields.placeholder: Note any postural compensations during breathing assessment...

secondary_fields.label: Additional Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Any additional observations about breathing mechanics...

breathing_pattern.clinical_significance: Diaphragmatic breathing promotes optimal musculoskeletal function

accessory_muscle_use.clinical_significance: Accessory muscle overuse indicates dysfunctional breathing pattern

interpretation_guide.normal: Diaphragmatic pattern with normal rate and no accessory muscle use
interpretation_guide.mild_dysfunction: Slight apical tendency with minimal accessory muscle use
interpretation_guide.significant_dysfunction: Paradoxical pattern or multiple accessory muscles active

ASSESS_052.name: TMJ Compression Test
ASSESS_052.purpose: Assess TMJ disc and joint irritability
ASSESS_052.description: Compresses TMJ to reproduce symptoms. Part of comprehensive TMJ evaluation.

technique.procedure: Apply posterior force to chin bilaterally
technique.positive_finding: Pain reproduction in TMJ

options.label: Negative
options.description: No pain or symptoms reproduced with compression

options.label: Positive
options.description: Pain or symptoms reproduced with compression

options.label: Inconclusive
options.description: Unable to perform test due to patient factors

primary_fields.label: Pain Intensity (0-10)
primary_fields.description: Rate the intensity of pain reproduced during compression

secondary_fields.label: Muscle Guarding Present
secondary_fields.description: Patient exhibits protective muscle spasm or guarding

options.label: Deviates Right
options.description: Jaw shifts to the right during compression

options.label: Deviates Left
options.description: Jaw shifts to the left during compression

secondary_fields.label: Clinical Observations
secondary_fields.placeholder: Any additional observations about TMJ response to compression...

test_result.clinical_significance: Positive test indicates TMJ disc derangement or inflammation

interpretation_guide.negative: Normal TMJ response to compression - no disc derangement
interpretation_guide.positive_unilateral: Possible unilateral TMJ dysfunction or disc derangement
interpretation_guide.positive_bilateral: Consider systemic TMJ disorder or bilateral disc problems

ASSESS_053.name: TMJ Lateral Deviation Test
ASSESS_053.description: Identifies unilateral TMJ restrictions or muscle imbalances.

technique.procedure: Patient moves jaw side to side
technique.positive_finding: Asymmetry >10mm difference or deviation during opening

primary_fields.label: Right Lateral Excursion (mm)
primary_fields.description: Measure lateral jaw movement to the right in millimeters

primary_fields.label: Left Lateral Excursion (mm)
primary_fields.description: Measure lateral jaw movement to the left in millimeters

primary_fields.label: Maximum Mouth Opening (mm)
primary_fields.description: Maximum interincisal distance during opening

primary_fields.label: Protrusion Distance (mm)
primary_fields.description: Forward jaw movement in millimeters

options.label: Deviates Right
options.description: Jaw deviates to the right during opening

options.label: Deviates Left
options.description: Jaw deviates to the left during opening

options.label: C-Curve
options.description: Jaw follows a C-shaped path during opening

options.label: S-Curve
options.description: Jaw follows an S-shaped path during opening

secondary_fields.label: Asymmetry Observations
secondary_fields.placeholder: Describe any asymmetries in movement patterns...

secondary_fields.label: Additional Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Any additional observations about TMJ movement...

lateral_excursion_right.clinical_significance: Reduced lateral excursion indicates joint or muscle restriction

lateral_excursion_left.clinical_significance: Reduced lateral excursion indicates joint or muscle restriction

mouth_opening.clinical_significance: Reduced opening suggests joint pathology or muscle dysfunction

computed_fields.hypomobility: mouth_opening < 40 or lateral_excursion_right < 10 or lateral_excursion_left < 10 or protrusion < 5

interpretation_guide.normal: All measurements within normal ranges with no deviation
interpretation_guide.mild_dysfunction: Minor asymmetries or slight deviation patterns
interpretation_guide.moderate_dysfunction: Significant asymmetries or consistent deviation patterns
interpretation_guide.severe_dysfunction: Major restrictions or complex movement patterns

ASSESS_054.name: Scapular Assistance Test
ASSESS_054.purpose: Assess scapular contribution to shoulder dysfunction
ASSESS_054.description: Manually assists scapular upward rotation to determine if it improves shoulder symptoms.

technique.procedure: Manually assist scapular upward rotation during arm elevation
technique.positive_finding: Decreased pain or increased ROM with assistance

ASSESS_054.clinical_implication: Positive suggests scapular dyskinesis contributing to symptoms

options.label: Negative
options.description: No improvement in pain or ROM with scapular assistance

options.label: Positive
options.description: Decreased pain or increased ROM with assistance

options.label: Inconclusive
options.description: Unable to determine due to patient factors or poor cooperation

options.label: Pain Reduction
options.description: Shoulder pain decreased with scapular assistance

options.label: Increased Range of Motion
options.description: Greater shoulder elevation achieved with assistance

options.label: Reduced Impingement Signs
options.description: Less impingement pain during assisted movement

options.label: Scaption
options.description: Elevation in scapular plane (30° forward of frontal plane)

secondary_fields.label: Baseline Pain Level (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Pain level during unassisted arm elevation

secondary_fields.label: Pain Level With Assistance (0-10)
secondary_fields.description: Pain level during scapular-assisted arm elevation

secondary_fields.label: Baseline ROM (degrees)
secondary_fields.description: Maximum arm elevation without assistance

secondary_fields.label: Assisted ROM (degrees)
secondary_fields.description: Maximum arm elevation with scapular assistance

options.label: Posterior Tilt Assistance
options.description: Manually assisted posterior tilt of scapula

options.label: End Range Pain
options.description: Pain at end range of motion

options.label: Catching Sensation
options.description: Feeling of structures catching during movement

secondary_fields.label: Muscle Activation Observations
secondary_fields.placeholder: Describe any changes in muscle recruitment patterns with assistance...

secondary_fields.label: Additional Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Any additional observations about scapular function or test response...

assisted_rom_degrees.message: Assisted ROM should be greater than baseline ROM

test_result.clinical_significance: Positive test indicates scapular dyskinesis contributing to shoulder dysfunction

baseline_rom_degrees.clinical_significance: Reduced baseline ROM suggests shoulder pathology

interpretation_guide.negative: Scapular function not contributing to shoulder symptoms
interpretation_guide.positive_mild: Minor scapular contribution to shoulder dysfunction
interpretation_guide.positive_significant: Scapular dyskinesis major factor in shoulder symptoms

ASSESS_055.name: Scour Test (Hip)

technique.positive_finding: Pain, clicking, or catching sensation

options.label: Positive

options.description: Unable to perform test due to patient factors

options.label: Hip Extension

options.label: Hip Abduction
options.description: Hip moved into abduction during scour

options.description: Hip moved into adduction during scour

options.label: Internal Rotation
options.description: Hip moved into internal rotation during scour

options.label: External Rotation
options.description: Hip moved into external rotation during scour

options.description: Symptoms only at end ranges of movement

secondary_fields.description: Hip flexion angle maintained during test

options.description: Pain referred to other areas (thigh, knee, back)

secondary_fields.label: Specific Painful Position
secondary_fields.placeholder: Describe the specific hip position that reproduced symptoms...

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.placeholder: Compare findings between left and right hips...

secondary_fields.label: Additional Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Any additional observations about hip joint response...

normal_range.message: Standard test position is 90° hip flexion

test_result.clinical_significance: Positive test suggests intra-articular hip pathology

pain_intensity.clinical_significance: Higher pain intensity suggests more significant pathology

interpretation_guide.negative: Low probability of intra-articular hip pathology
interpretation_guide.positive_mechanical: Mechanical hip pathology likely - clicking, catching, or blocking
interpretation_guide.positive_inflammatory: Inflammatory hip pathology likely - pain without mechanical signs

ASSESS_056.name: Range of Motion Assessment
ASSESS_056.purpose: Assess joint range of motion and movement restrictions
ASSESS_056.description: Systematic evaluation of active and passive range of motion for any joint. Records degrees of movement and presence of pain.

technique.procedure: Measure active and passive ROM using goniometry, note pain or restrictions
technique.measurements: Record in degrees using anatomical position as 0°

secondary_fields.label: Bilateral Comparison
secondary_fields.placeholder: Compare to opposite side...

secondary_fields.label: Additional Clinical Notes
secondary_fields.placeholder: Any additional observations...

passive_greater_active.message: Passive ROM should generally be ≥ Active ROM

rom_range_check.message: ROM values must be between 0 and 360 degrees

interpretation_guide.capsular_pattern: Specific pattern of restriction suggests joint pathology
